intro: Aster pulicarius, commonly known as the mouse ear aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features fuzzy, silver-green leaves that are heart-shaped at the base. Its flowers are small, blue to purple in color, and bloom in the late summer to early autumn. Aster pulicarius is often found in moist meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates.
